title: Need Help With id
content:
I Need Help with IDing this type i am doing a sign for a customer and i need tho find out what the type is but the customer does not know.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pioneer_5329.png)
author: bean_086

comments.content:
I couldn't find an exact match, but it's very close to [Ethnocentric by Typodermic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/ethnocentric/), specifically the Light weight. Here's a sample, compared to the isolated PIONEER text.

Original:  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050im_/http:/i.imgur.com/C7twVZY.png)

Ethnocentric:  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050im_/http:/origin2.myfonts.net/a_91/u/89/0f56c0679532d122bbac3837ebfffa.gif)

[Helion](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fonthead/helion/regular/) might work for another 'close but no cigar' choice.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050im_/http:/typophile.com/files/snap_3586.png)
Yeah its real close to ethocentric book but the slant on the p and r are opposite and the o is too round. Thanks for helping

Can't find a match either. BTW, feels custom to me. Not sure these open /P, /R and rounded finials are original... May be having a look to some sections at Dafont would be helpful: [Techno \> Sci-fi](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303) and [Techno \> Various](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804112050/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304). Good luck!
